intro: Chrysaspis badia subsp. rytidosemia, commonly known as the silverleaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and attractive appearance. The subspecies rytidosemia is distinguished by its unique leaf morphology and floral structure compared to other members of the species.
